reactionTimeTest.percentile: Your reaction time is in the top {percent}%.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.description: This test accurately measures your reaction time to visual stimuli.

steps.1: Click the 'Click to start.' button, and the screen will turn red.
steps.2: After a random delay of 2 to 7 seconds, the screen will turn green.
steps.3: Click as quickly as possible when you see the green screen.
steps.4: Your reaction time will be displayed in milliseconds (ms).

tips.title: Tips for Improving Performance
tips.description: Here are some tips to help improve your reaction time.

tipsList.2: Maintain overall health with regular exercise.
tipsList.3: Caffeine can temporarily enhance reaction time.
tipsList.5: Video games may help improve reaction time.

notes.1: Try multiple attempts to get an average result. Single attempts may be influenced by chance.
notes.2: Clicking too early will display the message 'Clicked too soon!'.
notes.3: Minimize distractions in your environment during the test.
notes.4: Results may be less accurate on mobile devices due to touch delay.

facts.1: The average human reaction time is about 250ms.
facts.2: F1 racing drivers have an average reaction time of around 100 to 150ms.
facts.3: Olympic sprinters' reaction times are typically between 120 and 160ms.
facts.4: Reaction time to sound is generally about 20 to 50ms faster than to visual stimuli.
